formalpara.title: Figure 17. Modularity of Rac signaling in axon pathfinding.
formalpara.para: Rac GTPases MIG-2 and CED-10 control both stimulation and inhibition of neuronal protrusion in attractive versus repulsive UNC-6/Netrin-mediated axon guidance. The Racs act downstream of distinct receptor complexes (UNC-40 homodimers in attractive/stimulatory, and UNC-40/UNC-5 heterodimers in repulsive/inhibitory). Different GEFs regulate the Racs in each (TIAM-1 in attractive/stimulatory and UNC-73/Trio in repulsive/inhibitory). The stimulatory pathway influences the actin cytoskeleton via Arp/23 and UNC-115/abLIM, and the inhibitory might modulate the microtubule cytoskeleton via UNC-33/CRMP and UNC-44/Ankyrin.
